incidents.name: Asset Optimization Content serving 404

incident_updates.body:
All sites should now be working correctly.

A correction on the previous message: Netlify Forms with file uploads would have completely failed to submit (error 500), so data successfully submitted to Netlify has not been lost.

The team has implemented a fix. The sites should be automatically working without any configuration change from the users' end. We're monitoring the issue closely.

However, form submissions with file uploads would have failed from 10:46 UTC to 14:32 UTC. These files would be irrecoverably lost.

We're investigating some issues with serving asset optimization content. This can include bundled CSS, JS and minified image files. These files would show 404 errors when requested.

Currently, affected users can disable Asset Optimization from site settings and re-deploy.

incidents.name: Issue with logging into Netlify

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. Customers should now be able to log into Netlify.
Our team has applied mitigation and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the issue and are working on a fix. Correction to the start time that was initially reported, the start time is 10:46 UTC.
The team is investigating an issue with logging into Netlify that started at 11:13 UTC.

incidents.name: Go binary installation failure in Netlify Builds

incident_updates.body:
Since December 13, 2022 14:30 UTC, we're seeing errors while installing Go in our build systems across all tiers. This has caused build errors for users trying to rely on Go binaries in their builds, for example, some Hugo builds, or Netlify Functions using Go. Previously deployed sites were not affected. This has been resolved as of December 17 18:28 UTC.

Users that use Go, either the default Go version and created their site on or after November 22, 2022 11:14:34 UTC or manually set their Go version to 1.19.x either via the environment variable GO_VERSION or the file .go-version, were affected.

incidents.name: Increased Errors in Edge Functions

incident_updates.body: Beginning at 16:24 UTC, traffic through Edge Functions was failing due to an upstream issue. This has now been fully resolved and all services are operational.
The team has mitigated the root cause of this issue and continue to monitor to ensure service remains stable.
The team has identified the root cause and are working toward a resolution.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Our team is seeing increased errors with Edge Functions beginning at 16:24 UTC and are currently investigating

incidents.name: Increased errors in Serverless functions

incident_updates.body: We’ve isolated this to a single customer, and it’s not impacting other customers.
Since 04:30 UTC we’ve been experiencing increased error rates in Serverless functions. The team is investigating.

incidents.name: HTTP 500 errors for visitors in Northeastern USA region on our Standard Edge CDN

incident_updates.body: Between approximately 18:17 UTC and 19:57 UTC, Northeastern US area visitors to sites on our Standard Edge network may have experienced HTTP 500 errors while attempting to access uncached content on sites.  This affected a very small percentage of our overall traffic and access in other regions and access to our sites on the High-Performance Edge were not impacted.

incidents.name: Investigating build logs not showing in our UI

incident_updates.body: No further impact expected;  we will continue to monitor, but will mark this incident as resolved.

Build logs in our UI have returned to normal behavior and visibility.  Some logs may have been lost between approximately 19:35 UTC and 20:55 UTC, and some builds may have failed due to associated network connectivity issues.  We do not expect further impact on our builds nor UI but the team will continue to monitor."
Our team is investigating reports of not showing build/deploy logs in our UI.

incidents.name: Accounts incorrectly marked as overdue

incident_updates.body: Our team identified and mitigated the root cause of this issue. Our team will continue to monitor

Our team keeps investigating the issue that caused a banner to be displayed in the Netlify UI indicating the account is past due, and an email requesting to update your payment method.

We are actively investigating the problem and we will post an update here as soon as we have a fix for the issue.

This is an aesthetic issue in Netlify, and rest assured that web content and the rest of the Netlify functionalities will keep working as expected for those accounts that have been accidentally flagged as past due.
We're continuing to investigate the root cause of this issue but can confirm no sites are affected and accounts have been charged correctly.
We’re investigating an issue with our payment system that is incorrectly considering accounts as overdue

incidents.name: SSL/TLS provisioning issue

incident_updates.body: This incident is now resolved and all SSL/TLS provisioning is fully operational.

We are successfully provisioning a majority of new and existing SSL certificates. Additionally, we are monitoring our SSL provisioning while Let's Encrypt completes a planned network maintenance at this time.
We have identified the issue and are working on a fix.
We are currently investigating an issue affecting provisioning new and modifying existing SSL certificates. Existing SSL certificates are not impacted outside of not being able to be modified.

incidents.name: Build Failures with Scoped Environment Variables

incident_updates.body: Between 21:28 to 21:37 UTC, all builds utilizing our experimental feature "Scoped Environment Variables" may have failed due to an internal error. We have mitigated the root issue and now all builds are succeeding as of 21:37 UTC. Any previous failed build will need to be retried via our UI.

incidents.name: Problem serving some Next.js images in recent builds

incident_updates.body: Fix has been verified by our team and several customers, so we'll resolve this incident.  Note that this affected only customers who had built with v 4.24.2 of our Next.js runtime, and used the specific IPX configuration mentioned in an earlier message.
We've released v 4.24.3 of our Next.js runtime with a fix, and it will be automatically used for all new deploys.  Our team will continue to monitor.

In version 4.24.2 of the Next.js runtime, there is an issue with local images served by next/image from outside /_next/static/media. This will manifest in the error Invalid source image path. This can be worked around by rolling back to the previous deploy, or upgrading to version 4.24.3, when we finish releasing it shortly.

incidents.name: Connection Timeouts on Standard Edge Network Load Balancer.

incident_updates.body: The issue on our legacy TCP load balancer with IP 104.198.14.52 has been resolved.
Since 11:50 UTC our legacy TCP load balancer with IP 104.198.14.52 is no longer suffering connection timeouts. The team continues to monitor.

Starting at 11:29 UTC our legacy TCP load balancer with IP 104.198.14.52 is suffering connection timeouts due to an upstream provider problem. Customers still pointing to this Load Balancer via A records can instead follow our Netlify docs here:https://docs.netlify.com/domains-https/custom-domains/configure-external-dns/#configure-an-apex-domain

components.name: Standard Edge Network

incidents.name: Hosted DNS records not changeable

incident_updates.body: Our provider has resolved their incident and DNS changes have been working normally for the past 15 minutes and all backlog has been processed.  We do not expect any further impact from this incident to your usage of our hosted hosted DNS.

We have again deactivated DNS changes as our service provider continues to work to resolve the incident.  Contrary to the prior update, no records have been changed since 21:14 UTC.  We'll post again with an update as soon as the fix is available.

API requests for DNS record creation or change are succeeding again, and we have processed the backlog of pending changes that we enqueued without returning an error.  In case you received a message about records not being changeable from our UI or API, you should now be able to perform those changes manually.  Our team will continue to monitor until our service provider marks their incident as resolved.

Our service is currently unable to change, create, or delete DNS records since 16:14 UTC.  We are working with our service provider to repair.  Until we have resolved the situation, our UI will show error messages about not applying any changes in case you attempt these operations.
